layouts.Example: Single page in "posts" section with layout set
Section list for "posts" section with type set to "blog"
Section list for "posts" section with layout set to "demoLayout"

ToFloat.Description: ToFloat converts the given value to a float.

ToInt.Description: ToInt converts the given value to an int.

ToString.Description: ToString converts the given value to a string.

And.Description:
And computes the Boolean AND of its arguments, returning
the first false argument it encounters, or the last argument.

Conditional.Description:
Conditional can be used as a ternary operator.
It returns a if condition, else b.

Eq.Description: Eq returns the boolean truth of arg1 == arg2.

Ge.Description: Ge returns the boolean truth of arg1 >= arg2.
Examples: {{ if ge .Hugo.Version "0.36" }}Reasonable new Hugo version!{{ end }}

Gt.Description: Gt returns the boolean truth of arg1 > arg2.

Le.Description: Le returns the boolean truth of arg1 <= arg2.

Lt.Description: Lt returns the boolean truth of arg1 < arg2.

Ne.Description: Ne returns the boolean truth of arg1 != arg2.

Not.Description: Not returns the Boolean negation of its argument.

Or.Description:
Or computes the Boolean OR of its arguments, returning
the first true argument it encounters, or the last argument.

After.Description: After returns all the items after the first N in a rangeable list.

Apply.Description: Apply takes a map, array, or slice and returns a new slice with the function fname applied over it.

Complement.Description:
Complement gives the elements in the last element of seqs that are not in
any of the others.
All elements of seqs must be slices or arrays of comparable types.

The reasoning behind this rather clumsy API is so we can do this in the templates:
   {{ $c := .Pages | complement $last4 }}

Delimit.Description:
Delimit takes a given sequence and returns a delimited HTML string.
If last is passed to the function, it will be used as the final delimiter.

Dictionary.Description:
Dictionary creates a map[string]interface{} from the given parameters by
walking the parameters and treating them as key-value pairs.  The number
of parameters must be even.

EchoParam.Description:
EchoParam returns a given value if it is set; otherwise, it returns an
empty string.

First.Description: First returns the first N items in a rangeable list.

Group.Description:
Group groups a set of elements by the given key.
This is currently only supported for Pages.

In.Description: In returns whether v is in the set l.  l may be an array or slice.
Examples: {{ if in "this string contains a substring" "substring" }}Substring found!{{ end }}

Index.Description:
Index returns the result of indexing its first argument by the following
arguments. Thus "index x 1 2 3" is, in Go syntax, x[1][2][3]. Each
indexed item must be a map, slice, or array.

Copied from Go stdlib src/text/template/funcs.go.

We deviate from the stdlib due to https://github.com/golang/go/issues/14751.

TODO(moorereason): merge upstream changes.

Intersect.Description:
Intersect returns the common elements in the given sets, l1 and l2.  l1 and
l2 must be of the same type and may be either arrays or slices.

IsSet.Description:
IsSet returns whether a given array, channel, slice, or map has a key
defined.

KeyVals.Description: KeyVals creates a key and values wrapper.

Last.Description: Last returns the last N items in a rangeable list.

Merge.Description:
Merge creates a copy of dst and merges src into it.
Currently only maps supported. Key handling is case insensitive.
Examples: {{ dict "title" "Hugo Rocks!" | collections.Merge (dict "title" "Default Title" "description" "Yes, Hugo Rocks!") | sort }}
{{  merge (dict "title" "Default Title" "description" "Yes, Hugo Rocks!") (dict "title" "Hugo Rocks!") | sort }}

NewScratch.Description:
NewScratch creates a new Scratch which can be used to store values in a
thread safe way.

Querify.Description: Querify encodes the given parameters in URL-encoded form ("bar=baz&foo=quux") sorted by key.

Seq.Description:
Seq creates a sequence of integers.  It's named and used as GNU's seq.

Examples:
    3 => 1, 2, 3
    1 2 4 => 1, 3
    -3 => -1, -2, -3
    1 4 => 1, 2, 3, 4
    1 -2 => 1, 0, -1, -2

Shuffle.Description: Shuffle returns the given rangeable list in a randomised order.

Slice.Description: Slice returns a slice of all passed arguments.

SymDiff.Description:
SymDiff returns the symmetric difference of s1 and s2.
Arguments must be either a slice or an array of comparable types.

Union.Description:
Union returns the union of the given sets, l1 and l2. l1 and
l2 must be of the same type and may be either arrays or slices.
If l1 and l2 aren't of the same type then l1 will be returned.
If either l1 or l2 is nil then the non-nil list will be returned.

Uniq.Description:
Uniq takes in a slice or array and returns a slice with subsequent
duplicate elements removed.

Where.Description: Where returns a filtered subset of a given data type.

MD5.Description: MD5 hashes the given input and returns its MD5 checksum.

SHA1.Description: SHA1 hashes the given input and returns its SHA1 checksum.

SHA256.Description: SHA256 hashes the given input and returns its SHA256 checksum.

GetCSV.Description:
GetCSV expects a data separator and one or n-parts of a URL to a resource which
can either be a local or a remote one.
The data separator can be a comma, semi-colon, pipe, etc, but only one character.
If you provide multiple parts for the URL they will be joined together to the final URL.
GetCSV returns nil or a slice slice to use in a short code.

GetJSON.Description:
GetJSON expects one or n-parts of a URL to a resource which can either be a local or a remote one.
If you provide multiple parts they will be joined together to the final URL.
GetJSON returns nil or parsed JSON to use in a short code.

Base64Decode.Description: Base64Decode returns the base64 decoding of the given content.

Base64Encode.Description: Base64Encode returns the base64 encoding of the given content.

Jsonify.Description: Jsonify encodes a given object to JSON.

Errorf.Description:
Errorf formats according to a format specifier and returns the string as a
value that satisfies error.

Print.Description: Print returns string representation of the passed arguments.

Printf.Description: Printf returns a formatted string representation of the passed arguments.

Println.Description: Println returns string representation of the passed arguments ending with a newline.

Config.Description:
Config returns the image.Config for the specified path relative to the
working directory.

Humanize.Description:
Humanize returns the humanized form of a single parameter.

If the parameter is either an integer or a string containing an integer
value, the behavior is to add the appropriate ordinal.

    Example:  "my-first-post" -> "My first post"
    Example:  "103" -> "103rd"
    Example:  52 -> "52nd"

Pluralize.Description: Pluralize returns the plural form of a single word.

Singularize.Description: Singularize returns the singular form of a single word.

NumFmt.Description:
NumFmt formats a number with the given precision using the
negative, decimal, and grouping options.  The `options`
parameter is a string consisting of `<negative> <decimal> <grouping>`.  The
default `options` value is `- . ,`.

Note that numbers are rounded up at 5 or greater.
So, with precision set to 0, 1.5 becomes `2`, and 1.4 becomes `1`.

Translate.Description: Translate returns a translated string for id.

Ceil.Description: Ceil returns the least integer value greater than or equal to x.

Floor.Description: Floor returns the greatest integer value less than or equal to x.

Log.Description: Log returns the natural logarithm of a number.

ModBool.Description: ModBool returns the boolean of a % b.  If a % b == 0, return true.

Round.Description: Round returns the nearest integer, rounding half away from zero.

FileExists.Description: FileExists checks whether a file exists under the given path.

Getenv.Description:
Getenv retrieves the value of the environment variable named by the key.
It returns the value, which will be empty if the variable is not present.

ReadDir.Description: ReadDir lists the directory contents relative to the configured WorkingDir.

ReadFile.Description:
ReadFile reads the file named by filename relative to the configured WorkingDir.
It returns the contents as a string.
There is an upper size limit set at 1 megabytes.

Include.Description:
Include executes the named partial.
If the partial contains a return statement, that value will be returned.
Else, the rendered output will be returned:
A string if the partial is a text/template, or template.HTML when html/template.

IncludeCached.Description:
IncludeCached executes and caches partial templates.  An optional variant
string parameter (a string slice actually, but be only use a variadic
argument to make it optional) can be passed so that a given partial can have
multiple uses. The cache is created with name+variant as the key.

Join.Description:
Join joins any number of path elements into a single path, adding a
separating slash if necessary. All the input
path elements are passed into filepath.ToSlash converting any Windows slashes
to forward slashes.
The result is Cleaned; in particular,
all empty strings are ignored.

Split.Description:
Split splits path immediately following the final slash,
separating it into a directory and file name component.
If there is no slash in path, Split returns an empty dir and
file set to path.
The input path is passed into filepath.ToSlash converting any Windows slashes
to forward slashes.
The returned values have the property that path = dir+file.

IsMap.Description: IsMap reports whether v is a map.

IsSlice.Description: IsSlice reports whether v is a slice.

Fingerprint.Description:
Fingerprint transforms the given Resource with a MD5 hash of the content in
the RelPermalink and Permalink.

Get.Description:
Get locates the filename given in Hugo's filesystems: static, assets and content (in that order)
and creates a Resource object that can be used for further transformations.

Minify.Description:
Minify minifies the given Resource using the MediaType to pick the correct
minifier.

PostCSS.Description: PostCSS processes the given Resource with PostCSS

ToCSS.Description:
ToCSS converts the given Resource to CSS. You can optional provide an Options
object or a target path (string) as first argument.

CSS.Description: CSS returns a given string as html/template CSS content.

HTML.Description: HTML returns a given string as html/template HTML content.

HTMLAttr.Description: HTMLAttr returns a given string as html/template HTMLAttr content.

JS.Description: JS returns the given string as a html/template JS content.

JSStr.Description: JSStr returns the given string as a html/template JSStr content.

SanitizeURL.Description: SanitizeURL returns a given string as html/template URL content.

URL.Description: URL returns a given string as html/template URL content.

Chomp.Description: Chomp returns a copy of s with all trailing newline characters removed.

CountRunes.Description: CountRunes returns the number of runes in s, excluding whitepace.

CountWords.Description: CountWords returns the approximate word count in s.

FindRE.Description:
FindRE returns a list of strings that match the regular expression. By default all matches
will be included. The number of matches can be limited with an optional third parameter.
Examples: {{ findRE "[G|g]o" "Hugo is a static side generator written in Go." "1" }}

FirstUpper.Description: FirstUpper returns a string with the first character as upper case.

HasPrefix.Description: HasPrefix tests whether the input s begins with prefix.

Repeat.Description: Repeat returns a new string consisting of count copies of the string s.

Replace.Description:
Replace returns a copy of the string s with all occurrences of old replaced
with new.

ReplaceRE.Description:
ReplaceRE returns a copy of s, replacing all matches of the regular
expression pattern with the replacement text repl.

RuneCount.Description: RuneCount returns the number of runes in s.

SliceString.Description:
SliceString slices a string by specifying a half-open range with
two indices, start and end. 1 and 4 creates a slice including elements 1 through 3.
The end index can be omitted, it defaults to the string's length.

Split.Description: Split slices an input string into all substrings separated by delimiter.

Substr.Description:
Substr extracts parts of a string, beginning at the character at the specified
position, and returns the specified number of characters.

It normally takes two parameters: start and length.
It can also take one parameter: start, i.e. length is omitted, in which case
the substring starting from start until the end of the string will be returned.

To extract characters from the end of the string, use a negative start number.

In addition, borrowing from the extended behavior described at http://php.net/substr,
if length is given and is negative, then that many characters will be omitted from
the end of string.

Title.Description:
Title returns a copy of the input s with all Unicode letters that begin words
mapped to their title case.

ToLower.Description:
ToLower returns a copy of the input s with all Unicode letters mapped to their
lower case.

ToUpper.Description:
ToUpper returns a copy of the input s with all Unicode letters mapped to their
upper case.

Trim.Description:
Trim returns a string with all leading and trailing characters defined
contained in cutset removed.

TrimLeft.Description:
TrimLeft returns a slice of the string s with all leading characters
contained in cutset removed.

TrimPrefix.Description:
TrimPrefix returns s without the provided leading prefix string. If s doesn't
start with prefix, s is returned unchanged.

TrimRight.Description:
TrimRight returns a slice of the string s with all trailing characters
contained in cutset removed.

TrimSuffix.Description:
TrimSuffix returns s without the provided trailing suffix string. If s
doesn't end with suffix, s is returned unchanged.

Truncate.Description: Truncate truncates a given string to the specified length.
Examples: {{ "this is a very long text" | truncate 10 " ..." }}

Exists.Description:
Exists returns whether the template with the given name exists.
Note that this is the Unix-styled relative path including filename suffix,
e.g. partials/header.html

AsTime.Description:
AsTime converts the textual representation of the datetime string into
a time.Time interface.

Duration.Description:
Duration converts the given number to a time.Duration.
Unit is one of nanosecond/ns, microsecond/us/µs, millisecond/ms, second/s, minute/m or hour/h.

Format.Description:
Format converts the textual representation of the datetime string into
the other form or returns it of the time.Time value. These are formatted
with the layout string

Now.Description: Now returns the current local time.

ParseDuration.Description:
ParseDuration parses a duration string.
A duration string is a possibly signed sequence of
decimal numbers, each with optional fraction and a unit suffix,
such as "300ms", "-1.5h" or "2h45m".
Valid time units are "ns", "us" (or "µs"), "ms", "s", "m", "h".
See https://golang.org/pkg/time/#ParseDuration

Emojify.Description:
Emojify returns a copy of s with all emoji codes replaced with actual emojis.

See http://www.emoji-cheat-sheet.com/

HTMLEscape.Description: HTMLEscape returns a copy of s with reserved HTML characters escaped.
Examples: {{ htmlEscape "Cathal Garvey & The Sunshine Band <cathal@foo.bar>" | safeHTML}}
{{ htmlEscape "Cathal Garvey & The Sunshine Band <cathal@foo.bar>" | htmlUnescape | safeHTML }}

HTMLUnescape.Description:
HTMLUnescape returns a copy of with HTML escape requences converted to plain
text.
Examples: {{ htmlUnescape "Cathal Garvey & The Sunshine Band <cathal@foo.bar>" | safeHTML}}
{{"Cathal Garvey &amp; The Sunshine Band &lt;cathal@foo.bar&gt;" | htmlUnescape | htmlUnescape | safeHTML}}
{{"Cathal Garvey &amp; The Sunshine Band &lt;cathal@foo.bar&gt;" | htmlUnescape | htmlUnescape }}
{{ htmlUnescape "Cathal Garvey & The Sunshine Band <cathal@foo.bar>" | htmlEscape | safeHTML }}

Highlight.Description:
Highlight returns a copy of s as an HTML string with syntax
highlighting applied.

Markdownify.Description: Markdownify renders a given input from Markdown to HTML.

Plainify.Description: Plainify returns a copy of s with all HTML tags removed.

Remarshal.Description:
Remarshal is used in the Hugo documentation to convert configuration
examples from YAML to JSON, TOML (and possibly the other way around).
The is primarily a helper for the Hugo docs site.
It is not a general purpose YAML to TOML converter etc., and may
change without notice if it serves a purpose in the docs.
Format is one of json, yaml or toml.

Unmarshal.Description:
Unmarshal unmarshals the data given, which can be either a string
or a Resource. Supported formats are JSON, TOML, YAML, and CSV.
You can optionally provide an options map as the first argument.

AbsLangURL.Description:
AbsLangURL takes a given string and converts it to an absolute URL according
to a page's position in the project directory structure and the current
language.

AbsURL.Description: AbsURL takes a given string and converts it to an absolute URL.

Anchorize.Description: Anchorize creates sanitized anchor names that are compatible with Blackfriday.

Ref.Description: Ref returns the absolute URL path to a given content item.

RelLangURL.Description:
RelLangURL takes a given string and prepends the relative path according to a
page's position in the project directory structure and the current language.

RelRef.Description: RelRef returns the relative URL path to a given content item.

RelURL.Description:
RelURL takes a given string and prepends the relative path according to a
page's position in the project directory structure.

URLize.Description: URLize returns the given argument formatted as URL.
